name: gaillardia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a garden plant grown for its large attractive yellow, pinkish-red, or two-coloured flowers: Heat-loving dwarf gaillardia is happy in this southwest-facing spot. Herbaceous plants, such as gaillardias, are most easily propagated by root cuttings.
More examplesFewer examplesThe gaillardia was fully double and a rich shade of deep, brownish red.I should warn that you don't get much seed of the gaillardia in a packet.Cuttings of gaillardia are best laid thinly over the surface of a tray of compost and then covered with another layer of compost about half a centimetre thick.
